thread.title: Mumbaikars have rejected Shiv Sena’s approach on Pakistan, says Sudheendra Kulkarni
thread.title_full: Mumbaikars have rejected Shiv Sena’s approach on Pakistan, says Sudheendra Kulkarni

author: Wires English | India.com News Desk
title: Mumbaikars have rejected Shiv Sena’s approach on Pakistan, says Sudheendra Kulkarni
text:
Mumbaikars have rejected Shiv Sena’s approach on Pakistan, says Sudheendra Kulkarni By India.com News Desk on October 20, 2015 at 4:31 PM Comments 
After a series of incident carried out by Shiv Sena in Mumbai, Mumbaikars have rejected their approach on Pakistan, says Sudheendra Kulkarni, chairperson of the Observer Research Foundation, who was attacked by the right-wing party workers last week. 
Last Monday a handful of Sena ‘workers’ sploshed black ink on Kulkarni’s face, hours before a book launch by former Pakistan foreign minister Khurshid Mahmud Kasuri in Mumbai. 
The Sena workers and its leaders proudly defended the act saying that, “íts a non-violent method of protest”. (ALSO READ: BCCI succumbs to Shiv Sena diktat: Democracy gets quiet burial in Maharashtra) 
According to a newspaper report, Kulkarni was quoted saying that, “Mumbaikars have shown a strong sense of solidarity for the cause for which he was invited here. They have firmly rejected the Shiv Sena on both the right to have freedom of expression and the need to promote Indo-Pak. dialogue and normalisation of our relations.” 
A day after the attack on Kulkarni, Shiv Sena’s mouthpiece ‘Saamna’ compared him with 26/11 terrorist Ajmal Kasab and referrred him as a ‘lover of Pakistan’. 
The editorial in Saamna said, “Pakistan do not need people like Kasab to carry outr destructive activities in India, when persons like Kulkarni are present in the country”. 
“The real threat to India is not from extremist Muslims, but from the people like Kulkarni,” it said. 
On Monday Sena members barged into the BCCI office, protesting against Shahryar Khan, member of Pakistan Cricket Board. After the incident the PCB chairman had called IPL chief Rajiv Shukla but the talks on Indo-Pak series are still on hold. 
After the BCCI incident the social media went crazy, criticising against Sena ‘workers’. 
Instead of millions of criticism the Saamna on Tuesday carried out a front page headline, “Shiv Sena kaa yorker, BCCI clean Bold”.
